Instruction:
Task Description: Create a UDP-based poller class in JavaScript that can send ping messages to a target UDP server and handle pong responses, with timeout functionality.

Class Description: The UdpPoller class is designed to monitor UDP servers by sending periodic ping messages and listening for pong responses. It inherits from a base poller class and implements UDP communication using Node.js's dgram module.

Attributes:
- udpServer: [Object] - The UDP socket instance created using dgram module
- target: [Object/String] - The target server address and port (parsed from input URL)
- timeout: [Number] - The maximum time to wait for a response before timing out
- callback: [Function] - The callback function to be executed when a response is received or an error occurs

Methods:
- constructor(target, timeout, callback) -> [void] - Initializes the poller with target, timeout, and callback
- static get type() -> [String] - Returns the poller type ('udp')
- static validateTarget(target) -> [Boolean] - Validates if the target URL matches UDP format
- initialize() -> [void] - Sets up the UDP socket and parses the target address
- poll() -> [void] - Sends a ping message to the target server and sets up response listener
- onResponseCallback(message, sender) -> [void] - Handles incoming messages and processes pong responses
- timeoutReached() -> [void] - Cleans up socket listeners when timeout occurs
